Posts.Content: I’ve been officially diagnosed with invasive ductal breast cancer. There is also cancer in my nodes.  The biopsy results show that it’s ER+, they’re still waiting for the results of the HER2 test.  I needed a CT scan to check if it’s spread or not, there was a cancellation so I had that at 3:20pm this afternoon.  I’ll be having surgery, chemo and radiotherapy, but the order/type of treatment depends on the remaining test results which hopefully I’ll find out next Wednesday.
Posts.Title: Update after biopsy results today

Posts.Content: @ask123 my consultant has said that they will put a temporary implant in after the mastectomy and will do the final reconstruction after the radiotherapy is finished, so probably about a year down the line. I’m just going along with their advice, they’re the experts so I need to trust that they’re doing the best thing. I’m only 37 (almost 38) so need to make sure that whatever is done is the best thing long term.
Posts.Title: Update after biopsy results today

Posts.Content: Thanks for the replies. I’ve been told that I’ll be having a mastectomy, chemo and radiotherapy.  The type of chemo, the order of the treatment and whether I’ll have medication before the mastectomy all depends on the HER2 test as Mirabo says. I’d hoped to know the plan today but in hindsight I was a little naive. Next Wednesday I should know more.
Posts.Title: Update after biopsy results today

Posts.Content: I’ve been told that they’re taking all of my nodes (levels 1 and 2 I think they said). It sounds like I’m getting everything doesn’t it!  I’m so glad that you got through the other side of this thing and are doing well, it gives me hope x
Posts.Title: Update after biopsy results today

Posts.Content: I’m not cold capping, I’m not looking forward to my hair falling out but didn’t like the idea of the cold cap so that was that. My oncologist only mentioned the cold cap briefly and the nurses haven’t mentioned it at all.  I bought a couple of wigs from a lovely wig shop in Newcastle. Not sure if I’ll wear them yet as my head is already irritable but we’ll see.
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: I had my first session on Friday, and have been so tired ever since. I haven’t got out of bed yet today.  I’m having 6 sessions of FEC-T, I feel like my children won’t remember me when I’m finished as I’m hardly seeing them!  Other than the tiredness I think I’m doing alright, I've got a claggy mouth, headaches on and off, brain feels muddled, constantly thirsty, and a few aches and pains but that’s about it.  Good luck to everyone starting their chemo, I hope the side effects are kind to you x
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: The waiting is horrible isn’t it! I just want to get started now!  Good luck to you too, fingers crossed we both get there results soon x
Posts.Title: HER2 result delayed

Posts.Content: I was supposed to get the results of my HER2 test on Friday, I still haven’t received it. Apparently the dye that they use for testing ‘didn’t take’. Just wondering, has anyone else experienced this?
Posts.Title: HER2 result delayed

Posts.Content: Hi ladies. I hope you don’t mind me joining you on this thread, I’m having a central line fitted on Wednesday, then having my first treatment on Friday. I’m having FEC-T.  I’ve read lots but still not completely sure what to expect, im just planning to take each day as it comes and hope for the best!
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Thanks, I think I’m prepared with most things from the list attached to this post.  I hope everyone that has had a bad time of it / trips to A&E is feeling better soon x
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Thanks aliblue. When I had my pre-assessment the nurse said that because I’d had bad morning sickness and have 3 young children she’ll give me more than just the standard anti sickness meds from the start. Did you have to give yourself fail injections for 7 days after each chemo to help with white blood cell counts? I will which is fine but just wondering if you have any tips? Thanks x
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***
